column2: DELAWARE DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Delaware
column6: DE

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the solid line may pass.
column6: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: in both directions may pass.

column2: 2. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
column8: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 3. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: buckled up in the front seat.
column6: buckled up in the back seat.
column8: in the bed of a pick-up truck.

column2: 4. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: Regulatory.
column6: High emphasis warning.
column8: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 5. A diamond-shaped sign is a:
column4: regulatory sign.
column6: school zone sign.
column8: warning sign.

column2: 6. When you come to a flashing yellow light, you must:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: slow down and cross carefully.
column8: stop before crossing.

column2: 7. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column6: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: U-turns are prohibited
column6: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
column8: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

column2: 9. Drivers should always be looking:
column4: directly in front of the car.
column6: at the left lane.
column8: beside, ahead and to the rear of the vehicle.

column2: 10. If the driver of an oncoming vehicle fails to dim the lights, you should look:
column4: toward the right side of the road.
column6: toward the center of the roadway.
column8: straight ahead.

column2: 11. Drivers should change lanes:
column4: often.
column6: gradually and carefully.
column8: as quickly as possible.

column2: 12. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.

column2: 13. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 14. When you see this sign you should:
column4: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.

column2: 15. This road sign is:
column4: a speed reduction sign.
column6: a warning sign.
column8: a regulatory sign.

column2: 16. In work zones, barriers such as drums, panels and cones are used to:
column4: reduce the flow of traffic.
column6: keep traffic out of hazardous work zones.
column8: keep workers out of the work zone.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Crossroad
column6: Hospital parking ahead
column8: Merge

column2: 18. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 19. When in a motor vehicle on a highway, it is:
column4: acceptable to drink alcoholic beverages if you are not driving.
column6: illegal to possess an open container of alcohol in the passenger compartment.
column8: permissible to drink a moderate amount of alcohol when driving with a passenger.

column2: 20. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column4: no passing zone
column6: hill
column8: soft shoulder

column2: 21. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: black and orange.
column6: brown and white.
column8: green and white.

column2: 22. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: closetailing.
column6: speedgating.
column8: tailgating.

column2: 23. Traffic accidents resulting in personal injury must be reported:
column4: immediately.
column6: within 30 days.
column8: within 24 hours.

column2: 24. You should add antifreeze to washer fluid:
column4: to protect your windshield from extensive damage.
column6: to protect your wipers against moisture.
column8: to keep the washer fluid from freezing.

column2: 25. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: the first rain after a dry spell.
column6: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column8: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 26. The picture shows:
column4: a reversible road sign.
column6: a speeding fines doubled sign.
column8: a railroad advance warning sign.

column2: 27. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.
column6: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column8: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.

column2: 28. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right
column6: School zone ahead
column8: Two-way Traffic

column2: 29. If a child is about to run into the street, you should:
column4: flash your headlights.
column6: call the police.
column8: sound a sharp blast of your horn.

column2: 30. When passing a vehicle,  it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you look over your shoulder and see no vehicle behind you.
column8: the driver you just passed signals you over.
